abstract: Three-judge panel in Guatemala will decide if July trial of former dictator Jose Efrain Rios Montt, accused of responsibility for deaths of nearly 2,000 Mayan Indians between 1982 and 1983, will proceed; government-appointed experts have declared Montt mentally unfit for trial.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors say José Efraín Rios Montt is responsible for the deaths of 1,771 Mayan Indians killed by the army.

headline.print_headline: The Americas; Guatemala: Ex-Dictator Is Found Unfit

snippet: Prosecutors say José Efraín Rios Montt is responsible for the deaths of 1,771 Mayan Indians killed by the army.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
